The question refers to the image shown.

content.question: Works like Cranach’s Allegory of Law and Grace would have appealed to a wide audience because

choices.label: people believed that buying them would improve their chances of salvation
people believed that they were holy objects that possessed healing properties
prints on paper were a novelty and therefore considered to be status symbols
woodcuts were inexpensive and could be reproduced in large quantities

content.answer: woodcuts were inexpensive and could be reproduced in large quantities

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.1: Cultural Contexts of Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, content, function, and/or context of a work of art (or group of related works of art) elicit a response or shape its reception.
